Package arundel.core

Contains classes that define the components for building computational graphs.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Gate
    A Gate is the basic building block for the computational directed acyclic graph (DAG).
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Circuit
    Class Circuit encapsulates a computational directed acyclic graph of Gates.
    Link
    Class to establish the link between two gates in the computational circuit and enable the transimission of data between them.
    Operator  
    Placeholder
    A Placeholder is essentially a non-trainable Gate for storing labels.
    Variable
    Class to implement a Variable as component in the computation graph.

Package arundel.core Description

Contains classes that define the components for building computational graphs. All data is collected from Variables, processed in Operators and stored in placeholders. All computational units Variable, Operator, Placeholder implement the Gate interface. Hence the computation graph which is encapsulated as a Circuit is a directed acyclic graph (DAG) of Gates. See Circuit and Gate for more information in order to develop an intuition about the usage of this framework.

The Gate class is the basic building block of the computation graph a.k.a. Circuit. See more about Gate for information regarding the implementation required bu the Gate interface.

All computation is performed in the Operators. Hence it makes sense to place the trainable parmameters as inputs to the Operator instances and update them using Gate.update(). Learn more about Operators for implementation of computation.
